intro: Aliciella humillima, commonly known as the dwarf alicia, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Aliciella humillima is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and harsh weather conditions. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and environmental changes.
